datasetApaReference: Heine, C., Schmukle, S. C., & Dufner, M. (2024). The quest for genuine self-knowledge: An investigation into individual differences in the self-insight motive. European Journal of Personality, 0(0). https://doi.org/10.1177/08902070241272184

instruments.instrumentApaReference: Heine, C., Schmukle, S. C., & Dufner, M. (2024). The quest for genuine self-knowledge: An investigation into individual differences in the self-insight motive. European Journal of Personality, 0(0). https://doi.org/10.1177/08902070241272184

items.itemStemText: I want to know exactly what my strengths and weaknesses are.
I frequently compare myself to other people in order to find out how good or bad I am at certain things.
I want to know what kind of person I am in major importance to me.
I try to conclude from the reactions I receive from other people what character traits I possess.
When getting feedback about my work performance, I want exact details, even if they are negative.
I sometimes compare myself with the person I have been in previous times, and I think of how I changed since then.
Having accurate knowledge of my character traits is of great importance to me.
I deliberately seek feedback in order to ascertain my strengths and weaknesses.
I am very interested in what I am good at and what I should work on.
I look back on positive and negative feedback about my personality.
I regularly compare myself to other people in order to know my personality traits.
When friends give me feedback about how they perceive me as a person, I want that feedback to be as honest as possible.
It is important for me to understand how I became the person I am today.
I occasionally compare myself with people close to me in order to know my personality traits.
I carefully interpret the reactions of my self-images from time to time.
I deliberately seek feedback in order to find out exactly what my typical traits are.
I deliberately seek feedback in order to find out what I am good at and what I am bad at.
I sometimes compare myself to other people in order to know what kind of person I am.
I look back on positive as well as negative feedback about my personality traits.
